intro: Boscia teitensis, commonly known as the yellow boscia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Boscia teitensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
